question:

(i) Nuremberg and Tokyo trials
(ii) Gorbachevâ€™s appointment as Secretary General of CPSU
(iii) Islamic Revolution in Iran
(iv) CSCE meeting for formally ending the Cold War
Choose the correct answer from the code given below:
explanation:
The Nuremberg Trial and the Tokyo War Crimes Trials (1945-1948)
The Iranian Revolution (also known as the Islamic Revolution or the 1979 Revolution).
Mikhail Gorbachev is a Russian and formerly Soviet politician. The eighth and last leader of the Soviet Union, he was General Secretary of the governing Communist.
Party of the Soviet Union from 1985 until 1991.
CSCE meeting held in 1991 for formally ending the cold war.
